name: cleome
wildlife-value: Flowers attract bees, humming birds and butterflies
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
fruit-description: The capsule is an elongate, cylindrical 2-valved fruit filled with numerous seeds. Once the pods dry, they pop open to release the small round brown seeds
flower-description: Plants bloom from early summer until frost in a dense, 6-8 inch wide, ever-lengthening terminal raceme. Each 1–1½” wide individual flower on a 2-inch stem has 4 reflexed light green sepals, 4 clawed petals and 6 erect to spreading stamens that grow to 3-inches long with yellow-orange anthers. The petals may be white, pink, rose or purple.
leaf-description: The alternate leaves are palmately compound with 5-7 leaflets tapered at the base (although the leaves on the upper parts of the stems are smaller and simple). Compound leaves are 6-8 inches across. The leaflets are oval to lanceolate and their margins are smooth or serrated. There are prickles on the midrib on the underside of the leaf and a pair of small spiny stipules at the base of each leaf petiole and glandular pubescence, making it slightly sticky with exudate and a fetid smell.
stem-description: Stems are light green and covered with long glandular hairs.
